title: How to create a stage name for myself - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends to some extent on what precisely you want to be known as. I think a good name for a magician would be different from a comedian vs. a dramatic actor vs. character roles. I see these characteristics in stage names: Often, they are “like” or “reminiscent” of someone already famous. If you wanted to be a magician, for instance, it could be a different spelling of “Houdini” like “Whodini” the names “Barrymore” or “Fonda” or “Douglas” are associated with a number of excellent actors. You can also do a variant of those. Typically, stage names are unusual in some way to draw attention and make the reader do a double take. So, rather than “John Charles Thomas”, a better stage name might be “John Charl Thomas” or “J.Charles-Thomas” If you have a favorite character from fiction, you might pick that, possibly making a slight variation. If you enjoy brainstorming with friends, you might get together and spend 3–4 hours on it. In my experience, even after the collective brainstorming is over, all the participants keep coming up with good ideas for the next couple days so be sure to ask again. I chose “truthtable” as a pen name I often use because a “truthtable” is a fundamental formalism underlying computer science. My dad taught me about it when I was quite young so it also has a personal significance. It also means a place where people can work together (a table) to jointly develop the truth. Finally, it also refers to the idea of “tabling” the truth for a time in order to build a fictional world. I also have a blog with the name “PeterSIronwood” which I chose partly for the initials PSI which stand for “psychology” and also for my consulting practice, “Problem Solving International.” I like golf, so it is partly from “Iron” and “wood” as well as “ironwood” which is a really cool looking tree trunk. Be careful of “unintended side-effects” before making a final commitment however. It turns out that many “spell checkers” automatically turn “truthtable” into “tduthtable” which, so far as I know, means absolutely nothing so I have no idea why they do that! But it turns out to be an inconvenience. I wanted to name my consulting practice “!ProblemSolvingInternational” partly because in an alphabetical listing anything with a leading “!” should come first. However, many computer systems do not “allow” a “!” in the name so that was a fail. Be sure to let us know what you decide on so that we can when you’re famous! I don't think there are any rules in creating a stage name but I like how Iggy Azalea got her stage name. What she did was combining the name of the street where she lives and her dog name. That happens to be how many porn stars got their name but, who cares right? As long as it catchy and unique enough for people to remember you. What really matters is your determination and perseverance. Good luck.

Try not to think of it as a name... You could just sit around all day trying to think up names. But try this. Instead of thinking of names, try thinking of random words, like I even think Pseudonym is a cool name. Or you could come up with a whole lot of words, and try them out together. Or you could even ask some friends, and see what they think, and then mix up their ideas. Any of these might help. Have fun!

You must make it clear to yourself what signals you want to send with your new name.Are you a drama actor, a comedian, a writer of scifi novels, the singer in a death metal band, a porn star?Bernard Forestville would be a great name for a drama actor, but probably not for the death metal singer.H.O Huffelcraft is clearly a scifi writer, not a stand-up comedian.
Make one up! If you are a goth band, maybe “Johnny Fartz and the New World Vomits.” Or if you are a man, how about “Cliff Hanger?” Maybe you are a she: “Barb Hook.” Anything! Hope that helps.
